And as I had with me neither a mechanic nor any passengers, I set myself to attempt the difficult repairs all alone.
target: وعشان ماكانش معايا لا ميكانيكي ولا ركاب، جهزت نفسي إن أنا أحاول أنجح، لوحدي، في عملية تصليح صعبة زي دي.

source: It was a question of life or death for me.
target: كانت بالنسبالي مسألة حياة أو موت.

source: I had scarcely enough drinking water to last a week.
target: كلن معايا ماية يادوب تكفيني للشرب تمن تيام.

source: The first night, then, I went to sleep on the sand, a thousand miles from any human habitation.
target: أول ليلة بقى، نمت على الرمل على بعد ألف كيلو متر من أي مكان فيه ناس.

source: I was more isolated than a shipwrecked sailor on a raft in the middle of the ocean.
target: كنت فعلا معزول أكتر من واحد بيصارع الغرق على مركب صغير في وسط المحيط.

source: Thus you can imagine my amazement, at sunrise, when I was awakened by an odd little voice. It said:
target: فتخيلوا بقى مفاجئتي، مع طلوع النهار، لما صوت صغير غريب بيصحيني ويقول:

source: If you please, draw me a sheep!
What!
Draw me a sheep!
I jumped to my feet, completely thunderstruck.
target: نطيت وقفت على حيلي زي ما اكون اتكهربت.

source: I blinked my eyes hard.
I looked carefully all around me.
And I saw a most extraordinary small person, who stood there examining me with great seriousness.
target: وشوفت طفل صغير مدهش جدا وبيبحلق فيا.

source: Here you may see the best portrait that, later, I was able to make of him.
target: وده أحسن بورتريه، نجحت إني أرسمهوله بعديها.

source: But my drawing is certainly very much less charming than its model.
target: لكن رسمي، بكل تأكيد أقل روعة بكتير من الشكل الحقيقي.

source: That, however, is not my fault.
The grown-ups discouraged me in my painter’s career when I was six years old, and I never learned to draw anything, except boas from the outside and boas from the inside.
target: الكبار هما إللي ضيعو مستقبلي في الرسم، لما كان لسه عندي ست سنين، وماتعلمتش أرسم أي حاجة غير تعابين البوا من بره ومن جوه.

source: Now I stared at this sudden apparition with my eyes fairly starting out of my head in astonishment.
target: بصيت بقى للظهور العجيب ده وعينيا مبرقة من الدهشة.

source: Remember, I had crashed in the desert a thousand miles from any inhabited region.
target: ماتنسوش إن أنا على بعد ألف كيلومتر من أي منطقة فيها ناس.

source: And yet my little man seemed neither to be straying uncertainly among the sands, nor to be fainting from fatigue or hunger or thirst or fear.
target: ومع كده الولد الولد مش باين عليه إنه تايه، ولا إنه ميت من الخوف.

source: Nothing about him gave any suggestion of a child lost in the middle of the desert, a thousand miles from any human habitation.
target: مش باين عليه أي حاجه تقول إنه ولد تايه في وسط السحرا، على بعد ألف كيلو متر في أي منطقة فيها ناس.

source: When at last I was able to speak, I said to him:
target: ولما نجحت أخيرا إني أتكلم قلت له:

source: But, what are you doing here?
And in answer he repeated, very slowly, as if he were speaking of a matter of great consequence:
target: راح مكرر إللي قاله بشويش، زي مايكون الموضوع جد جدا:

source: If you please, draw me a sheep.
When a mystery is too overpowering, one dare not disobey.
target: لما اللغز يكون محير للدرجة دي، مش ممكن تكون عندنا الجرأة إننا منسمعش الكلام.

source: Absurd as it might seem to me, a thousand miles from any human habitation and in danger of death, I took out of my pocket a sheet of paper and my fountain pen.
target: وعلى قد غرابة الموضوع بالنسبالي، إن ده كله بيحصل لى بعد ألف كيلومتر من أي حتة حد عايش فيها، وفي وسط خطر الموت طلعت من جيبي ورقه وقلم حبر.

source: But then I remembered how my studies had been concentrated on geography, history, arithmetic, and grammar, and I told the little chap (a little crossly, too) that I did not know how to draw.
target: لكن إفتكرت إني مادرستش غير الجغرافيا، والتاريخ، والحساب، والنحو، فقلت للولد الصغير (وأنا باين عليا شوية العكننة) إني مبعرفش أرسم.

source: He answered me:
That doesn’t matter.
Draw me a sheep.
But I had never drawn a sheep. So I drew for him one of the two pictures I had drawn so often.
target: بما إن أنا عمري مارسمت خروف، رسمتله رسمة من الإتنين إللي مبعرفش أرسم غيرهم.

source: It was that of the boa constrictor from the outside.
And I was astounded to hear the little fellow greet it with, No, no, no! I do not want an elephant inside a boa constrictor.
target: وقد إيه إتصدمت لما سمعت صاحبنا الغير صرخ وقال: لأ!لأ! مش عايز فيل جوه تعبان.

source: A boa constrictor is a very dangerous creature, and an elephant is very cumbersome.
target: تعبان البوا خطر جدا، والفيل هيعملي زحمة.

source: Where I live, everything is very small.
What I need is a sheep.
So then I made a drawing.
He looked at it carefully, then he said:
No This sheep is already very sickly.
target: لأ! الخروف ده عيان من أولها.

source: Make me another.
So I made another drawing.
My friend smiled gently and indulgently. You see yourself, he said, that this is not a sheep.
target: فابتسم صديقي إبتساة ظريفة، وقالي وكإنه مسامحني على جهلي: إنت شايف كويس إن ده مش خروف

source: This is a ram.
It has horns.
So then I did my drawing over once more.
But it was rejected too, just like the others.
This one is too old.
I want a sheep that will live a long time.
By this time my patience was exhausted, because I was in a hurry to start taking my engine apart. So I tossed off this drawing.
target: وساعتها صبري نفذ، عشان كنت مستعجل إني أبتدي أفك الموتور بتاعي، فشخبطله الرسمه دي.

source: And I threw out an explanation with it.
This is only his box.
The sheep you asked for is inside.
I was very surprised to see a light break over the face of my young judge:
target: لكن إندهشت بجد لما شفت القاضي الصغير بتاعي وشه نور وقال:

source: That is exactly the way I wanted it!
target: هو ده بالظبط إللي كنت عايزه!

source: Do you think that this sheep will have to have a great deal of grass?
target: تفتكر الخروف ده هيحتاج حشيش كتير؟

source: Because where I live everything is very small.
There will surely be enough grass for him, I said.
It is a very small sheep that I have given you.
He bent his head over the drawing:
target: راح قرب راسه من الرسمة وقال:

source: Not so small that.
Look!
He has gone to sleep.
And that is how I made the acquaintance of the little prince.
target: وبالطريقة دي إتعرفت على الأمير الصغير.

source: Chapter 3
It took me a long time to learn where he came from.
target: إحتجت مدة طويلة عشان أفهم هو جاي منين.

source: The little prince, who asked me so many questions, never seemed to hear the ones I asked him.
target: الأمير الصغير كان بيسألني أسئلة كتيرة أوي، وبيتهيألي إنه عمره مابياخد باله إن أنا كمان باسأل.

source: It was from words dropped by chance that, little by little, everything was revealed to me.
target: لكن شويه كلمات نطقها بالصدفة، هي إللي واحدة واحدة، كشفتلي كل حاجة.

source: The first time he saw my air-plane, for instance (I shall not draw my air-plane; that would be much too complicated for me), he asked me:
target: مثلا، لما لمح لأول مرة الطيارة بتاعتي (مش هارسم طيارتي، عشان دي رسمة معقدة أوي بالنسبالي) سألني:

source: What is that object?
That is not an object.
It flies.
It is an air-plane.
It is my air-plane.
And I was proud to have him learn that I could fly.
target: وكنت فخور أوي إني أعرفه إن أنا باطير.

source: He cried out, then:
What!
You dropped down from the sky?
Yes, I answered, modestly.
Oh! That is funny!
And the little prince broke into a lovely peal of laughter, which irritated me very much.
target: وضحك الأمير الصغير ضحكة عالية أوي، ضحكة غاظتني أوي.

source: I like my misfortunes to be taken seriously.
target: أنا ماباحبش حد يستخف بالمصايب إللي بتحصلي.

source: Then he added:
So you, too, come from the sky!
target: يعني إنت كمان جاي من السما!

source: Which is your planet?
At that moment I caught a gleam of light in the impenetrable mystery of his presence; and I demanded, abruptly:
target: فقفشت على طول طرف الخيط، في لغز وجوده، واستجوبته بسرعه:

source: Do you come from another planet?
target: يعني إنت جاي من كوكب تاني؟

source: But he did not reply.
He tossed his head gently, without taking his eyes from my plane:
target: هز راسه بالراحة، ومن غير مايشيل عينه من عالى الطيارة بتاعتي، وقال:

source: It is true that on that you can’t have come from very far away.
target: صحيح، بالبتاعة إللي إنت كنت راكبها دي، مش ممكن تكون جاي من حتة بعيدة أوي.

source: And he sank into a reverie, which lasted a long time.
Then, taking my sheep out of his pocket, he buried himself in the contemplation of his treasure.
target: وراح مطلع الخروف بتاعي من جيبه، ودخل في حالة تأمل للكنز بتاعه إللي ماسكه في إيده.

source: You can imagine how my curiosity was aroused by this half-confidence about the other planets.
target: إنت متخيلين قد إيه حيرني، النص سر إللي كشفهولي عن الكواكب التانية.

source: I made a great effort, therefore, to find out more on this subject.
target: فصممت بقى إني أعرف عنه أكتر:

source: My little man, where do you come from?
target: إنت جاي منين يا أستاذ يا صغير؟

source: What is this ‘where I live,’ of which you speak?
Where do you want to take your sheep?
target: عايز تاخد الخروف بتاعي على فين؟

source: After a reflective silence he answered:
The thing that is so good about the box you have given me is that at night he can use it as his house
target: أحسن حاجة في العلبة إللي إنت إديتهالي، إنها تنفع تبقلى بيته بالليل.

source: That is so.
And if you are good I will give you a string, too, so that you can tie him during the day, and a post to tie him to.
target: ولو إنت كويس، هديك كمان حبل عشان تربطه بالنهار. وكمان خشبة تدقها في الأرض.

source: But the little prince seemed shocked by this offer:
target: باين إن العرض بتاعي صدم الأمير الصغير:

source: Tie him! What a queer idea!
But if you don’t tie him, I said, he will wander off somewhere, and get lost.
target: أصل إنت لو مربطتهوش، ممكن يروح في أي حتة، وهيضيع

source: My friend broke into another peal of laughter:
target: وساعتها صاحبي ضحك تاني من قلبه:

source: But where do you think he would go?
Anywhere.
Straight ahead of him.
Then the little prince said, earnestly:
target: راح الأمير الصغير معلق بغيظ على كلامي وقال:

source: That doesn’t matter. Where I live, everything is so small!
And, with perhaps a hint of sadness, he added:
target: وكمل كلامه بطريقة بيتهيألي إني لمحت فيها شوية حزن:

source: Straight ahead of him, nobody can go very far.
target: لو أخد في وشه ومشي على طول مش هيروح بعيد أوي

source: I had thus learned a second fact of great importance:
target: بالطريقة دي عرفت حاجة تانية مهمه أوي:

source: this was that the planet the little prince came from was scarcely any larger than a house!
target: إن الكوكب الأصلي بتاعه يادوب أكبر شويه من البيت!

source: But that did not really surprise me much.

I knew very well that in addition to the great planets, such as the Earth, Jupiter, Mars, Venus, to which we have given names, there are also hundreds of others, some of which are so small that one has a hard time seeing them through the telescope.
target: أنا كنت عارف إن غير الكواكب الكبيرة إللي بنديها أسامي معروفة زي الأرض، والمشتري، والمريخ، والزهرة، فيه غيرهم آلاف الكويكبات الصغيره جدا. صغيرة لدرجة إننا بنلاحظهم بصعوبة شديدة حتى بالتلسكوبات.

source: When an astronomer discovers one of these he does not give it a name, but only a number. He might call it, for example, Asteroid 325.
target: ولما عالم فلك يكتشف كويكب منهم، بيديله نمرة بدل الإسم مثلا:الكويكب3251.

source: I have serious reason to believe that the planet from which the little prince came is the asteroid known as B-612.
target: عندي أسباب وجيهة تخليني أعتقد إن الكوكب إللي جاي منه الأمير الصغير هو الكويكب b612.

source: This asteroid has only once been seen through the telescope. That was by a Turkish astronomer, in 1909.
target: الكويكب ده ماتلمحش غير مرة واحدة بالتلسكوب، سنة 1919، لمحه عالم فلك تركي.

source: On making his discovery, the astronomer had presented it to the International Astronomical Congress, in a great demonstration.
target: وساعتها عمل عرض كبير وأثبت إكتشافه في مؤتمر دولي للفك.

source: But he was in Turkish costume, and so nobody would believe what he said.
Grown-ups are like that.
Fortunately, however, for the reputation of Asteroid B-612, a Turkish dictator made a law that his subjects, under pain of death, should change to European costume.
target: ولحسن الحظ، جه ديكتاتور تركي وأنقذ سمعة الكويكب b612 لما فرض على شعبه إنهم يلبسو لبس أوروبي تحت التهديد بالإعدام.

source: So in 1920 the astronomer gave his demonstration all over again, dressed with impressive style and elegance.
target: عالم الفلك عاد تاني عرض إكتشافه سنة 1920، وهو لابس آخر شياكة.

source: And this time everybody accepted his report.
target: والمرة دي كل الناس إتفقو معاه على نفس رأيه.

source: If I have told you these details about the asteroid, and made a note of its number for you, it is on account of the grown-ups and their ways.
target: لما حكيتلكم كل التفاصيل دي عن الكويكب b612 ولما إديتلكم رقمه، ده كان بسبب الكبار. الكبار بيحبو الأرقام .

source: When you tell them that you have made a new friend, they never ask you any questions about essential matters.
target: لما بتكلموهم عن صاحب جديد، مش بيسألوكم أبدا عن الحجات الضرورية.

source: They never say to you, What does his voice sound like?
target: مش بيقولولكم أبدا: صوته عامل إزاي؟

source: What games does he love best?
Does he collect butterflies?
Instead, they demand: How old is he?
How many brothers has he?
How much does he weigh?
How much money does his father make?
Only from these figures do they think they have learned anything about him.
target: ساعتها بس بيفتكرو إنهم إتعرفو عليه.

source: If you were to say to the grown-ups: I saw a beautiful house made of rosy brick, with geraniums in the windows and doves on the roof, they would not be able to get any idea of that house at all.
target: لو قلتو للكبار:أنا شفت بيت جميل مبني بطوب لونه بمبني، وعلى شبابيكه ورد وعلى السطوح بتاعه فيه حمام، مش هيقدرو يتخيلو شكل البيت ده.

source: You would have to say to them: I saw a house that cost $ 20,000.
target: لازم يتقالهم: أنا شفت بيت تمنه مليون جنيه.

source: Then they would exclaim: Oh, what a pretty house that is!
target: في الحالة دي هيصرخو وبقولوا:ده تحفه!

source: Just so, you might say to them:
The proof that the little prince existed is that he was charming, that he laughed, and that he was looking for a sheep.
target: دليل وجود الأمير الصغير إنه كان زي القمر، إنه كان بيضحك، إنه كان عايز خروف.

source: If anybody wants a sheep, that is a proof that he exists.
target: ولما حد يكون عايز خروف، ده دليل على إنه موجود

source: They would shrug their shoulders, and treat you like a child.
target: هيهزو كتافهم ويعاملوك على إنك عيل!

source: But if you said to them: The planet he came from is Asteroid B-612, then they would be convinced, and leave you in peace from their questions.
target: لكن لو قلتلهم: الكوكب إللي جاي منه الأمير الصغيرهو الكويكبb612 هيقتنعو على طول، وهيسبوك في حالك ويريحوك من أسئلتهم.

source: They are like that.
One must not hold it against them.
target: ومش لازم يتزعل منهم ولا يتلام عليهم.

source: Children should always show great forbearance toward grown-up people.
But certainly, for us who understand life, figures are a matter of indifference.
target: لكن، طبعا، الناس إللي فاهمين الدنيا زينا، بيتريقو جامد على الأرقام!

source: I should have liked to begin this story in the fashion of the fairy-tales.
target: كنت أتمنى أبتدي القصة دي على طريقة حواديت العفاريت.

source: I should have like to say: Once upon a time there was a little prince who lived on a planet that was scarcely any bigger than himself, and who had need of a sheep.
target: كان ياما كان، كان فيه أمير صغير عايش على كوكب، يادوب أكبر منه بحبة، وكان محتاج لصاحب

source: To those who understand life, that would have given a much greater air of truth to my story.
target: وبالنسبة للناس اللي فاهمين الحياة، كانو هيحسو إن الموضوع حقيقي أكتر

source: Fori do not want any one to read my book carelessly.
target: عشان أنا ماحبش إن كتابي يتقري على إنه حاجة هايفة.

source: I have suffered too much grief in setting down these memories.
target: أنا حاسس بحزن جامد وأنا باحكي الذكريات دي.

source: Six years have already passed since my friend went away from me, with his sheep.
target: فاتت ست سنين فعلا من ساعة ما صاحبي روح ومعاه الخروف بتاعه.

source: If I try to describe him here, it is to make sure that I shall not forget him.
target: ولما حاولت أوصفه هنا، ده كان عشان منساهوش.

source: To forget a friend is sad.
target: حاجه محزنة إن الواحد ينسى صاحبه.

source: Not every one has had a friend.
target: مش أي حد بيبقى عنده صاحب.

source: And if I forget him, I may become like the grown-ups who are no longer interested in anything but figures.
target: وكنت ممكن أبقى زي الكبار إللي مش بيهتمو إلا بالأرقام.

source: It is for that purpose, again, that I have bought a box of paints and some pencils.
target: عشان كده كمان اشتريت إشتريت بقى علبة ألوان وأقلام رصاص.

source: It is hard to take up drawing again at my age, when I have never made any pictures except those of the boa constrictor from the outside and the boa constrictor from the inside, since I was six.
target: صعب أوي إني أرجع للرسم تاني في سني ده، وخصوصا لو ماكانش عندي أي محاولات غير بتاعت التعبان من بره والتعبان من جوه، لما كان عندي ست سنين!

source: I shall certainly try to make my portraits as true to life as possible.
target: طبعا هحاول أعمل بورتريه يشبهه على قد ما اقدر.

source: But I am not at all sure of success.
target: بس مش متأكد أوي إني هنجح.

source: One drawing goes along all right, and another has no resemblance to its subject.
target: مرة رسمة تطلع شبهه والتانية ملهاش دعوة بيه.

source: I make some errors, too, in the little prince’s height.
In one place he is too tall and in another too short.
target: هنا مثلا الأمير الصغير طويل أوي. وهناك قصير أوي.

source: And I feel some doubts about the colour of his costume.
So I fumble along as best I can, now good, now bad, and I hope generally fair-to-middling.
target: فباخبط شوية كده وشويه كده، ولكن أحسن من مافيش.

source: In certain more important details I shall make mistakes, also.
target: كمان باغلط في شوية تفاصيل مهمة أكتر.

source: But that is something that will not be my fault.
My friend never explained anything to me.
target: صديقي ماكانش بيديني أبدا أي تفسيرات.

source: He thought, perhaps, that I was like himself.
But I, alas, do not know how to see sheep through the walls of boxes.
target: لكن لسوء حظي، أنا ماعرفش أشوف الخرفان إللي جوه العلب.

source: Perhaps I am a little like the grown-ups.
target: أنا يمكن أكون زي الكبار شويه.

source: I have had to grow old.
As each day passed I would learn, in our talk, something about the little prince’s planet, his departure from it, his journey.
target: كل يوم كنت باعرف حاجة جديدة عن الكوكب، عن السفر، عن الرحلة.

source: The information would come very slowly, as it might chance to fall from his thoughts.
target: كانت بتبان واحدة واحدة، بالصدفة مع ردود الأفعال.

source: It was in this way that I heard, on the third day, about the catastrophe of the baobabs.
target: وبالطريقة دي، عرفت في تالت يوم، مأساة شجر الباوباب العملاق.

source: This time, once more, I had the sheep to thank for it. For the little prince asked me abruptly, as if seized by a grave doubt:
target: المرة دي كمان، إللي عرفته كان بفضل الخروف، عشان الأمير الصغير سألني فجأة، وكأن شك فظيع سيطر عليه:

source: It is true, isn’t it, that sheep eat little bushes?
target: هو صحيح الخرفان بتاكل الشجر الصغير، مش كده؟

source: Yes, that is true.
Ah! I am glad!
I did not understand why it was so important that sheep should eat little bushes.
target: مافهمتش ليه مهم للدرجة دي إن الخرفان تاكل الشجر الصغير.

source: But the little prince added:
Then it follows that they also eat baobabs?
target: يبقى بالتالي بياكلو كمان شجر الباوباب.

source: I pointed out to the little prince that baobabs were not little bushes, but, on the contrary, trees as big as castles; and that even if he took a whole herd of elephants away with him, the herd would not eat up one single baobab.
target: شرحت للأمير الصغير إن الباوباب مش شجر صغير، دي الشجرة الواحدة منها ممكن تبقى كبيرة قد القلعة، ولو أخد معاه حتى قطيع أفيال، القطيع ده مش هيجيب طرف شجرة باوباب واحدة.

source: The idea of the herd of elephants made the little prince laugh.
target: فكرة قطيع الأفيال ضحكت الأمير الصغير:

source: We would have to put them one on top of the other, he said.
But he made a wise comment:
target: وبعدها علق على كلامي بكل حكمة:

source: Before they grow so big, the baobabs start out by being little.
target: شجر الباوباب، قبل ما يكبر، بيكون فب الأول صغير.

source: That is strictly correct, I said.
But why do you want the sheep to eat the little baobabs?
target: بس إنت ليه عايز الخرفان بتوعك ياكلو الباوباب الصغير؟

source: He answered me at once, Oh, come, come!, as if he were speaking of something that was self-evident.
target: فجاوبني: ما الموضوع واضح! وكأن الحكاية باينة زي الشمس.

source: And I was obliged to make a great mental effort to solve this problem, without any assistance.
target: واحتجت ذكاء خارق عشان أفهم لوحدي المشكلة دي.

source: Indeed, as I learned, there were on the planet where the little prince lived, as on all planets, good plants and bad plants.
target: في الواقع، على الكوكب بتاع الأمير الصغير، زيه زي كل الكواكب التانية، فيه زرع مفيد وزرع مؤذي.

source: In consequence, there were good seeds from good plants, and bad seeds from bad plants.
target: والبتالي فيه بزور الزرع المفيد وفيه بزور الزرع المؤذي.

source: But seeds are invisible.
target: لكن البزور لا حد بيشوفها ولا حد بيحس بيها.

source: They sleep deep in the heart of the earth’s darkness, until some one among them is seized with the desire to awaken.
target: بتكون نايمة في بطن الأرض لحد ما يخطر على بال واحده فيهم إنها تصحى.

source: Then this little seed will stretch itself and begin, timidly at first, to push a charming little sprig inoffensively upward toward the sun.
target: ساعتها بتتمطع، وتبتدي تدور على الشمس وهي مكسوفة، وتطلعلنا عود رقيق صغير مافيش خطر منه.

source: If it is only a sprout of radish or the sprig of a rose-bush, one would let it grow wherever it might wish.
target: لو طلع عود فجل أو غصن ورد بلدي، ممكن يتساب يكبر زي ماهو عايز.

source: But when it is a bad plant, one must destroy it as soon as possible, the very first instant that one recognises it.
target: لكن لو طلع زرع مؤذي، لازم الزرعة تتشال أول ما تتعرف وفي أسرع الوقت.

source: Now there were some terrible seeds on the planet that was the home of the little prince; and these were the seeds of the baobab.
target: وفي الحقيقة كان فيه بزور بشعة على كوكب الأمير الصغير، كان فيه بزور شجر الباوباب.

source: The soil of that planet was infested with them.
A baobab is something you will never, never be able to get rid of if you attend to it too late.
target: والباوباب بالذات لو سيبنا له شوية، مستحيل نخلص منه أبدا بعد كده.

source: It spreads over the entire planet.
It bores clear through it with its roots.
And if the planet is too small, and the baobabs are too many, they split it in pieces.
target: ولو كان كوكب صغير أوي، ولوكان فيه باوباب كتير أوي، ممكن شجر الباوباب يفرقع الكوكب.

source: It is a question of discipline, the little prince said to me later on.
target: دي مسألة إلتزام، ده إللي قالهولي الأمير الصغير بعد كده.

source: When you’ve finished your own toilet in the morning, then it is time to attend to the toilet of your planet, just so, with the greatest care.
target: زي ما بنغسل أسنانا ونسرح شعرنا الصبح، لازم كمان ننضف الكوكب بعناية وإهتمام.

source: You must see to it that you pull up regularly all the baobabs, at the very first moment when they can be distinguished from the rosebushes, which they resemble so closely in their earliest youth.
target: ضروري الواحدى يلزم نفسه إنه يشيل الباوباب بإنتظام أول مايقدر يفرق بينه وبين الورد، لأنهم بيكونو شبه بعض أوي وهما لسه صغيرين.

source: It is very tedious work, the little prince added, but very easy.
target: دي شغلانه مملة موت، بس سهلة على الأخر.

source: And one day he said to me: You ought to make a beautiful drawing, so that the children where you live can see exactly how all this is.
target: وفي يوم نصحني إني أصمم على رسمة حلوة، تنجح إنها تخلي الموضوع ده يدخل في دماغ الأولاد عندنا.

source: That would be very useful to them if they were to travel some day.
target: وقالي ده ممكن ينفعهم أوي لو في يوم حبو يسافرو.

source: Sometimes, he added, there is no harm in putting off a piece of work until another day.
target: ساعات مابيبقاش فيه ضرر لو أجلنا شغل النهاردة لبكره.

source: But when it is a matter of baobabs, that always means a catastrophe.
target: بس دايما التأجل ده بيبقى كارثة، لو الشغل له علاقة بشجر الباوباب.

source: I knew a planet that was inhabited by a lazy man.
target: أنا كنت أعرف كوكب سكنه واحد كسلان.

source: He neglected three little bushes.
So, as the little prince described it to me, I have made a drawing of that planet.
target: وعلى حسب توجيهات الأمير الصغير، رسمت الكوكب ده.

source: I do not much like to take the tone of a moralist.
target: أنا عموما ماباحبش أعمل فيها واعظ.

source: But the danger of the baobabs is so little understood, and such considerable risks would be run by anyone who might get lost on an asteroid, that for once I am breaking through my reserve.
target: بس قليلين إللي يعرفو خطر شجر الباوباب، ولو الواحد تاه على كويكب، المخاطر إللي ممكن يتعرض لها ممكن تكون فظيعة، لدرجة إن المرة دي غيرت اللي أنا متعود عليه.

source: Children, I say plainly, watch out for the baobabs!
target: وباقول: ياولاد! خلو بالكم من الباوباب!

source: My friends, like myself, have been skirting this danger for a long time, without ever knowing it; and so it is for them that I have worked so hard over this drawing.
target: أنا هريت نفسي شغل على الرسمة اللي تحت دي عشان أحذر أصحابي من الخطر اللي حواليهم من زمان، الخطر اللي أنا وهما ما كناش نعرف حاجة عنه.

source: The lesson which I pass on by this means is worth all the trouble it has cost me.
target: الدرس اللي كان لازم أخليه يوصل كان يستاهل.

source: Perhaps you will ask me, Why are there no other drawing in this book as magnificent and impressive as this drawing of the baobabs?
target: يمكن تكونو بتسألو نفسكم: ليه مافيش في الكتاب ده رسمة بنفس عظمة الباوباب؟

source: The reply is simple.
I have tried. But with the others I have not been successful.
When I made the drawing of the baobabs I was carried beyond myself by the inspiring force of urgent necessity.
target: لكن لما رسمت الباوباب مشاعري هي اللي كانت بتحركني.

source: Oh, little prince! Bit by bit I came to understand the secrets of your sad little life.
target: ياه! يا أمير يا صغير، حبة حبة، فهمت حياتك الحزينة.

source: For a long time you had found your only entertainment in the quiet pleasure of looking at the sunset.
target: قعدت مدة طويلة مافيش حاجة تسليك غير غروب الشمس ورقته.

source: I learned that new detail on the morning of the fourth day, when you said to me:
target: أنا عرفت التفاصيل الجديدة دي،رابع يوم الصبح، لما قولت لي:

source: I am very fond of sunsets.
Come, let us go look at a sunset now.
But we must wait, I said.
Wait? For what? For the sunset.
We must wait until it is time.
At first you seemed to be very much surprised. And then you laughed to yourself.
target: في الأول كان باين عليك مستغرب جدا، وبعدين ضحكت من نفسك.

source: You said to me:
I am always thinking that I am at home!
target: أنا لسه فاكر نفسي في البيت عندي!

source: Just so. Everybody knows that when it is noon in the United States the sun is setting over France.
target: في الحقيقة، زي ما كل الناس عارفة، لما الدنيا بتبقى الضهر في أمريكا، الشمس بتكون بتغرب في فرنسا.

source: If you could fly to France in one minute, you could go straight into the sunset, right from noon.
target: ولوعايزين نشوف الغروب، كل اللي محتاجينه إننا نقدر نروح فرنسا في دقيقة واحده.

source: Unfortunately, France is too far away for that.
target: لكن لسوء الحظ فرنسا بعيدة أوي.

source: But on your tiny planet, my little prince, all you need do is move your chair a few steps.
target: لكن على كوكبك المحندق، يكفيك إنك تشد الكرسي بتاعك كام خطوة.

source: You can see the day end and the twilight falling whenever you like.
target: وساعتها كل مرة تحب تشوف الشمس وهي بتغيب، هاتشوفها...

source: One day, you said to me, I saw the sunset forty-four times!
target: في يوم، إتفرجت على الغروب تلاتة وأربعين مرة!

source: And a little later you added:
You know, one loves the sunset, when one is so sad.
target: إنت عارف...لما نكون زعلانين أوي، بنحب غروب الشمس...

source: Were you so sad, then? I asked, on the day of the forty-four sunsets?
target: إنت كنت زعلان أوي للدرجة دي في اليوم بتاع التلاتة وأربعين مرة؟

source: But the little prince made no reply.
On the fifth day, again, as always, it was thanks to the sheep, the secret of the little prince’s life was revealed to me.
target: اليوم الخامس، وبرضو بفضل الخروف، إنكشفلي سر حياة الأمير الصغير.

source: Abruptly, without anything to lead up to it, and as if the question had been born of long and silent meditation on his problem, he demanded:
target: سألني فجأه، ومن غير مقدمات، وكأن سكوته كان نتيجة حيرة كبيرة جواه:

source: A sheep; if it eats little bushes, does it eat flowers, too?
target: الخروف، لو بساكل العيدان، يعني بياكل الورود كمان؟

source: A sheep, I answered, eats anything it finds in its reach.
Even flowers that have thorns?
Yes, even flowers that have thorns.
Then the thorns, what use are they?
I did not know.
At that moment I was very busy trying to unscrew a bolt that had got stuck in my engine.
target: وكنت مشغول بفك مسمار معصلج جامد في الموتور بتاعي.

source: I was very much worried, for it was becoming clear to me that the breakdown of my plane was extremely serious. And I had so little drinking water left that I had to fear for the worst.
target: كنت قلقان أوي عشان إبتدى يبان إن العطل صعب جدا، وماية الشرب إللي بتخلص خلتني أخاف من إللي ممكن يحصل.

source: The thorns, what use are they?
The little prince never let go of a question, once he had asked it.
target: الأمير الصغير لما بيسأل سؤال عمره ما بيتنازل عنه ابدا ولا حتى مرة واحدة في حياتي.

source: As for me, I was upset over that bolt. And I answered with the first thing that came into my head:
target: كنت متغاظ من المسمار ورديت بأي كلام:

source: The thorns are of no use at all. Flowers have thorns just for spite!
target: الشوك، مالوش لازمه، ده مجرد شر من الورود!

source: Oh!
There was a moment of complete silence.
target: لكن بعد ما سكت شوية رد عليا بنوع من الغضب:

source: I don’t believe you!
Flowers are weak creatures. They are naive.
They reassure themselves as best they can.
target: هم بيحاولو يطمنو نفسهم بأي طريقه.

source: They believe that their thorns are terrible weapons.
target: دول فاكرين نفسهم فظاع بالشوك بتاعهم

source: I did not answer.
At that instant I was saying to myself:
target: كنت باقول لنفسي في اللحظة دي:

source: If this bolt still won’t turn, I am going to knock it out with the hammer.
target: لو المسمار دا عصلج أكتر من كده، هاديله خبطة بالشاكوش تطلعه.

source: Again the little prince disturbed my thoughts.
target: ساعتها الأمير الصغير شوش كمان مرة على أفكاري:

source: And you actually believe that the flowers.
Oh, no! I cried.
No, no no! I don’t believe anything.
I answered you with the first thing that came into my head.
Don’t you see, I am very busy with matters of consequence!
He stared at me, thunderstruck.
Matters of consequence!
He looked at me there, with my hammer in my hand, my fingers black with engine grease, bending down over an object which seemed to him extremely ugly.
target: كان باصصلي، والشاكوش في إيدي، وصوابعي سودة من الشحم، وكنت موطي على حاجة شكلها وحش أوي بالنسباله.

source: You talk just like the grown-ups!
That made me a little ashamed.
target: كلامه خلاني أتكسف من نفسي شوية.

source: But he went on, relentlessly:
You mix everything up together.
You confuse everything.
He was really very angry.
He tossed his golden curls in the breeze.
target: وشعره الدهبي كان بيهتز في الهوا:

source: I know a planet where there is a certain red-faced gentleman.
target: كنت أعرف كوكب فيه راجل محمر.

source: He has never smelled a flower.
He has never looked at a star.
And all day he says over and over, just like you
target: طول النهار بيكرر نفس إللي بتقوله:

source: I am busy with matters of consequence!
target: أنا راجل مهم! أنا راجل مهم!

source: And that makes him swell up with pride.
target: وده كان بيخليه يتنفخ من كتر الغرور.

source: But he is not a man, he is a mushroom!
target: لكن ده مش إنسان. ده بطيخة.

source: A what?
A mushroom!
The little prince was now white with rage.
target: الأمير الصغير كان لونه في الوقت ده إتغير من كتر العصبية.

source: The flowers have been growing thorns for millions of years.
target: من ملايين السنين الورود بيطلعلوا شوك.

source: For millions of years the sheep have been eating them just the same.
target: وبالرغم من ده، من ملايين السنين الخرفان بتاكل الورود.

source: And is it not a matter of consequence to try to understand why the flowers go to so much trouble to grow thorns, which are never of any use to them?
target: ودي مش حاجة مهمة إننا ندور عشان نفهم ليه الورود بيتعبو نفسهم للدرجة ديعشان يصنعو شوك مالوش لازمة؟

source: Is the warfare between the sheep and the flowers not important?
target: مش الحرب إللي بين الخرفان الورود؟

source: Is this not of more consequence than a fat red-faced gentleman’s sums?
target: مش ده أهم من حسابات واحد راجل تخين ووشه أحمر؟

source: And if I know, I, myself, one flower which is unique in the world, which grows nowhere but on my planet, but which one little sheep can destroy in a single bite some morning, without even noticing what he is doing, Oh! You think that is not important!
target: ولو أنا كنت أعرف ورده مفيش زيها في الدنيا، مش موجود منها في أي حتة، غير علر الكوكب بتاعي. وخروف صغير، في يوم الصبح ممكن يدمرها،كده، بخبطة واحدة، من غير حتى ما ياخد باله من إللي هو بيعمله، ده مش مهم!

source: His face turned from white to red as he continued:
If some one loves a flower, of which just one single blossom grows in all the millions and millions of stars, it is enough to make him happy just to look at the stars.
target: لو فيه واحد بيحب وردة مافيش منها غير نسخة واحدة في وسط ملايين وملايين النجوم، ده كفايه إنه يخليه سعيد بمجرد إنه يبصلهم.

source: He can say to himself, Somewhere, my flower is there.
target: بيقول لنفسه: الوردة بتاعتي موجودة في حتة هنا...

source: But if the sheep eats the flower, in one moment all his stars will be darkened.
target: لكن لو الخروف أكل الوردة، هيبقى بالنسباله زي ماتكون كل النجوم إنطفت فجأة!

source: And you think that is not important!
He could not say anything more.
target: وماقدرش يقول حاجة أكثر من كدة.

source: His words were choked by sobbing.
The night had fallen.
I had let my tools drop from my hands.
Of what moment now was my hammer, my bolt, or thirst, or death?
target: شفت كل حاجة تافهة جدا، شاكوشي، مسماري، والعطش وحتى الموت.

source: On one star, one planet, my planet, the Earth, there was a little prince to be comforted.
target: عشان فيه على نجمة،على كوكب، الكوكب بتاعي، الأرض، فيه أمير صغير لازم أصالحه!

source: I took him in my arms, and rocked him.
I said to him: The flower that you love is not in danger.
target: قلت له:الوردة إللي بتحبها مش في خطر

source: I will draw you a muzzle for your sheep.
I will draw you a railing to put around your flower.
I will.
I did not know what to say to him.
I felt awkward and blundering.
I did not know how I could reach him, where I could overtake him and go on hand in hand with him once more.
target: ماكنتش عارف أوصلله إزاي أو حتى أقرب منه.

source: It is such a secret place, the land of tears.
target: قد إيه غامض جدا عالم الدموع.

source: I soon learned to know this flower better.
target: بسرعة، إبتديت أتعرف أكتر على الوردة دي.

source: On the little prince’s planet the flowers had always been very simple.
target: على كوكب الأمير الصغير، كان فيه دايما ورود بسيطة جدا

source: They had only one ring of petals; they took up no room at all; they were a trouble to nobody.
target: عندهم صف ورق واحد، ماكانوش بياخدو مكان كبير، وماكانوش بيزعجو حد.

source: One morning they would appear in the grass, and by night they would have faded peacefully away.
target: الصبح وسط الحشيش وبعدها بيدبلو بالليل.

source: But one day, from a seed blown from no one knew where, a new flower had come up; and the little prince had watched very closely over this small sprout which was not like any other small sprouts on his planet.
target: لكن في يوم، الوردة الثانية دي نبتت من بزرة ماحدش عارف جت منين، والأمير الصغير راقب من قريب أوي العود ده إللى ماكانش بيشبه باقي العيدان التانية.

source: It might, you see, have been a new kind of baobab.
target: كان ممكن يكون نوع جديد من الباوباب.

source: The shrub soon stopped growing, and began to get ready to produce a flower.
target: لكن الزرعة الصغيرة بطلت تكبر وإبتـدت تخلق وردة .

source: The little prince, who was present at the first appearance of a huge bud, felt at once that some sort of miraculous apparition must emerge from it.
target: في الوقت ده، الأمير الصغير كان بيتفرج عليها، ومن حجمها كان حاسس إن هيظهر منها معجزة.

source: But the flower was not satisfied to complete the preparations for her beauty in the shelter of her green chamber.
target: لكن الوردة فضلت مدة طويلة في الخفا، بتحضر نفسها ويتتزوق جوه أوضتها الخضـرا .

source: She chose her colours with the greatest care.
She adjusted her petals one by one.
target: كانت بتلبس بشويش وكانت بتظبت ورقها ورقة ورقة.

source: She did not wish to go out into the world all rumpled, like the field poppies.
It was only in the full radiance of her beauty that she wished to appear.
target: ماكانتش عايزة تظهر إلا في أجمل صـورهـا.

source: Oh, yes! She was a coquettish creature!
And her mysterious adornment lasted for days and days.
Then one morning, exactly at sunrise, she suddenly showed herself.
target: وأخيرا في يوم، الصـبح ساعة طلوع الشمس بالظبط، بينت نفسها.

source: And, after working with all this painstaking precision, she yawned and said:
target: ما عملت كل ده بمنتهى الدقة، قالت وهي بتتاوب:

source: Ah! I am scarcely awake.
I beg that you will excuse me.
My petals are still all disarranged.
But the little prince could not restrain his admiration:
Am I not? the flower responded, sweetly.
And I was born at the same moment as the sun.
target: مع إني لسه مولودة وقت لما الشمس إتولدت

source: The little prince could guess easily enough that she was not any too modest, but how moving, and exciting she was!
target: الأمير الصغير إستنتج على طول إنها ماكانتش متواضعة أوي لكن كانت ساحرة!

source: I think it is time for breakfast, she added an instant later.
target: بعدها قالتله على طول: بيتهيألي ده وقت الفطار

source: If you would have the kindness to think of my needs
target: يا ترى طيبتك هتخليك تهتم إنك تاخد بالك مني

source: And the little prince, completely abashed, went to look for a sprinkling can of fresh water. So, he tended the flower.
target: الأمير الصغير جاب رشاش ماية وهو متلخبط على الآخر، وسقى الوردة.

source: So, too, she began very quickly to torment him with her vanity, which was, if the truth be known, a little difficult to deal with.
target: وبالطريقة دي إبتدت تعذبه بغرورها الصعب،

source: One day, for instance, when she was speaking of her four thorns, she said to the little prince:
target: مثلا، في يوم، وهي بتكلمه عن الأربع شوكات بتوعها، قالت للأمير الصغير:

source: Let the tigers come with their claws!
There are no tigers on my planet, the little prince objected.
target: الأمير الصغير وضح لها: مافيش نمور على كوكبي

source: And, anyway, tigers do not eat weeds.
I am not a weed, the flower replied, sweetly.
target: ردت الوردة بشويش: أنا مش حشيش.

source: Please excuse me.
I am not at all afraid of tigers, she went on, but I have a horror of drafts.
target: النمور مش بيخوفوني في حـاجـة، لكن تيارات الهوا بترعبني.

source: I suppose you wouldn’t screen for me?
A horror of drafts, that is bad luck, for a plant, remarked the little prince, and added to himself,
target: الأمير الصغير قـال جـواه: بتترعب من تيارات الهوا ... مافيش حاجة كده، مافيش زرع بيخاف من الهوا.

source: This flower is a very complex creature.
At night I want you to put me under a glass globe.
target: لما يجي الليل، غطيني بغطا إزاز.

source: It is very cold where you live.
In the place I came from.
But she interrupted herself at that point.
She had come in the form of a seed.
She could not have known anything of any other worlds.
target: مش ممكن تكون عرفت أي عالم تاني.

source: Embarrassed over having let herself be caught on the verge of such an untruth, she coughed two or three times, in order to put the little prince in the wrong.
target: واتكسـفت من نفسها لما إتفجئت إنها طلعت كذبة ساذجة كده، وكحت مرتين تلاتة، عشان تحسس الأمير الصغير إنه غلطان:

source: The screen?
I was just going to look for it when you spoke to me.
target: كنت هاجيبه بس كنت باتكلم معاكي!

source: Then she forced her cough a little more so that he should suffer from remorse just the same.
target: وخلت نفسها تكح بالعافية عشان توجعله ضميره.

source: So the little prince, in spite of all the good will that was inseparable from his love, had soon come to doubt her.
target: وبكده، وبالرغم من صـدق حبه ليها، إبتدي الأمير الصغير يشك فيها بسـرعـة.

source: He had taken seriously words which were without importance, and it made him very unhappy.
target: وأخد كلامها إللي مالوش معنى على إنه جـد، وفضـل حزين.

source: I ought not to have listened to her, he confided to me one day.
target: في يوم فضفضلي: ما کنتش لازم أسمع كلامها

source: One never ought to listen to the flowers.
One should simply look at them and breathe their fragrance.
Mine perfumed all my planet.
But I did not know how to take pleasure in all her grace.
This tale of claws, which disturbed me so much, should only have filled my heart with tenderness and pity.
target: حكاية المخالب غاظتني جدا، مع إنه كان المفروض تخليها تصعب عليا

source: And he continued his confidences:
The fact is that I did not know how to understand anything!
I ought to have judged by deeds and not by words.
target: كنت لازم احكم على تصرفاتها مش على كلامها.

source: She cast her fragrance and her radiance over me.
I ought never to have run away from her.
I ought to have guessed all the affection that lay behind her poor little stratagems.
target: كنت لازم أشـوف رقتها المتدارية ورا مكرها .

source: Flowers are so inconsistent!
But I was too young to know how to love her.
target: لكن أنا كنت صغير أوي عشان أعرف أحبها.

source: I believe that for his escape he took advantage of the migration of a flock of wild birds.
target: أفتكر إنه إستفاد من هجرة الطيور عشـان يهرب معاهم .

source: On the morning of his departure he put his planet in perfect order.
target: ونهار يوم سفره، رتب الكوكب بتاعه كويس .

source: He carefully cleaned out his active volcanoes.
He possessed two active volcanoes; and they were very convenient for heating his breakfast in the morning.
target: كان عنده بركانين شغالين. كانو مفيدين بالنسباله عشـان كان بيسخن عليهم فطاره.

source: He also had one volcano that was extinct.
But, as he said, One never knows!
target: لكن، زي ما كان بيقول، ماحدش عارف!

source: So he cleaned out the extinct volcano, too.
target: فاحتياطي برضـو، نضف البركان المطفي كمان.

source: If they are well cleaned out, volcanoes burn slowly and steadily, without any eruptions.
target: عـشـان لو البراكين إتنضفت كويس، بتغلي بشويش وبانتظام، من غير ما تعمل إنفجارات .

source: On our earth we are obviously much too small to clean out our volcanoes.
target: طبعا على الأرض بتاعتنا، إحنا حجمنا صـغير أوي مايسمحش إننا ننـضـف البراكين.

source: That is why they bring no end of trouble upon us.
target: عشـان كده بيسببولنا كمية مشاكل كبيرة.

source: The little prince also pulled up, with a certain sense of dejection, the last little shoots of the baobabs.
target: الأمير الصغير شال كمان، بحزن، أخر باوباب نبت.

source: He believed that he would never want to return.
target: كان فاكر نفسه مش هيرجع تاني أبدا .

source: But on this last morning all these familiar tasks seemed very precious to him.
target: لكن في النهارده، كل الشغل المعتاد كان بالنسباله مربح جدا.

source: And when he watered the flower for the last time, and prepared to place her under the shelter of her glass globe, he realised that he was very close to tears.
target: ولما سـقى الوردة لآخر مرة، وجهز الغطا الإزار عشان يحميها بيه، إكتشف قد إيه كان نفسه يعيط.

source: Goodbye, he said to the flower.
But she made no answer.
Goodbye, he said again.
The flower coughed.
But it was not because she had a cold.
target: بس المرة دي مش بسبب الزكام.

source: I have been silly, she said to him, at last.
target: وبعدها قالت له: أنا كنت عبيطة.

source: I ask your forgiveness.
Try to be happy.
He was surprised by this absence of reproaches.
He stood there all bewildered, the glass globe held arrested in mid-air.
target: ووقف في مكانه مرتبك، وفي إيـده الغطا.

source: He did not understand this quiet sweetness.
Of course I love you, the flower said to him.
It is my fault that you have not known it all the while.
target: بس إنت ماعرفتش أي حاجة عن الموضـوع ده، ودي غلطتي أنا.

source: That is of no importance.
target: لكن كل ده مالوش أي أهمية.

source: But you, you have been just as foolish as I.
Try to be happy.
Let the glass globe be.
I don’t want it any more.
But the wind.
My cold is not so bad as all that.
the cool night air will do me good.
I am a flower.
But the animals.
Well, I must endure the presence of two or three caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies.
target: لو أنا عايزة أتعرف على الفراشات يبقى لازم أستحمل دودة أو إتنين.

source: It seems that they are very beautiful.
target: أنا سمعت إن الفراشات حلوين أوي.

source: And if not the butterflies and the caterpillars who will call upon me?
You will be far away.
As for the large animals, I am not at all afraid of any of them.
target: أما بالنسبة للوحوش الكبيرة، أنا مش باخاف منه.

source: I have my claws.
And, naively, she showed her four thorns.
Then she added: Don’t linger like this.
You have decided to go away.
Now go!
For she did not want him to see her crying.
target: قالتله كده عشـان ماكانتش عايزاه يشـوفها بتعيط.

source: She was such a proud flower.
He found himself in the neighbourhood of the asteroids 325, 326, 327, 328, 329, and 330.
target: هو كان سـاكن في منطقة الكويكبات 325، 326، 327، 328، 329 و 330.

source: He began, therefore, by visiting them, in order to add to his knowledge.
target: وابتدا رحلته بزيارتهم عشـان يدور على حاجة تشـغله وعشان يتعلم .

source: The first of them was inhabited by a king.
target: أول كوكب زاره، كان ساكن عليه ملك .

source: Clad in royal purple and ermine, he was seated upon a throne, which was at the same time both simple and majestic.
target: كان لابس فرو وحرير، وكان قاعد على عرش بسيط جدا، لكن في نفس الوقت عظيم .

source: Ah! Here is a subject, exclaimed the king, when he saw the little prince coming.
target: وأول ما الملك لمح الأمير الصغير، صرخ: ياه! أهو واحد من الرعية.

source: And the little prince asked himself: How could he recognise me when he had never seen me before?
target: والأمير الصغير سأل نفسه: إزاي ممكن يعرفني مع إنه ماشافنيش قبل كده!

source: He did not know how the world is simplified for kings.
target: ماكانش يعرف إن الدنيا سهلة أوي بالنسبة للملوك .

source: To them, all men are subjects.
Approach, so that I may see you better, said the king, who felt consumingly proud of being at last a king over somebody.
target: والملك إللي كان فخور أوي إنه هيعمل ملك على حد، قاله: قرب عشان أشوفك كويس.

source: The little prince looked everywhere to find a place to sit down; but the entire planet was crammed and obstructed by the king’s magnificent ermine robe.
target: الأمير الصغير دور بعينيه على حتة يقعد فيها، لكن البالطو الفرو الفخم كان زاحم الكوكـب كلـه .

source: So he remained standing upright, and, since he was tired, he yawned.
It is contrary to etiquette to yawn in the presence of a king, the monarch said to him.
target: فالسلطان قاله: مش من الذوق إنك تتاوب قدام ملك.

source: I forbid you to do so.
I can’t stop myself, replied the little prince, thoroughly embarrassed.
target: فرد الأمير الصغير وهو مرتبك على الأخر: أنا مش قادر أمسك نفسي

source: I have come on a long journey, and I have had no sleep.
target: أنا جاي من سفر طويل ومانمتش

source: Ah, then, the king said. I order you to yawn.
target: في الحالة دي، أنا بأمرك تتاوب.

source: It is years since I have seen anyone yawning.
target: أنا من سـنين ماشفتش حد بيتاوب.

source: Yawns, to me, are objects of curiosity.
target: أنا عندي فضـول أشـوف الحكاية دي.

source: Come, now! Yawn again!
It is an order.
That frightens me. I cannot, any more. murmured the little prince, now completely abashed.
target: الأمير الصغير وشه إحمر وقال: دي حاجة تكسف. أنا مابقتش قادر

source: Hum! Hum! replied the king. Then I. I order you sometimes to yawn and sometimes to
target: إحم! إحم! يبقى أنا بأمرك تناوب شوية وشوية

source: He sputtered a little, and seemed vexed.
target: وبرطم الملك حبة وبان عليه الزعل.

source: For what the king fundamentally insisted upon was that his authority should be respected.
target: عشان اكثر حاجة تهم الملك إن سلطته تحترم.

source: He tolerated no disobedience.
target: هو مايستحملش إن حد مايسمعش كلامه .

source: He was an absolute monarch.
But, because he was a very good man, he made his orders reasonable.
target: ولكن، عشان هو كان ملك كويس، ماكانش بيؤمر إلا الأوامر المعقولة، والمقدور عليها .

source: If I ordered a general, he would say, by way of example, if I ordered a general to change himself into a sea bird, and if the general did not obey me, that would not be the fault of the general.
target: وكان بيقول بحكمة: لو أمرت قائد إنه يتحول لطائر النورس، والقائد ماسمعش كلامي، ماتبقاش غلطة القائد.

source: It would be my fault.
May I sit down? came now a timid inquiry from the little prince.
target: الأمير الصغير إستفسر بخجل: ممكن أقعد؟

source: I order you to do so, the king answered him, and majestically gathered in a fold of his ermine mantle.
target: رد الملك، وهو بيسحب ديل البالطو الفرو بتاعه بعظمة، وقال: أنا بأمرك إنك تقعد.

source: But the little prince was wondering.
The planet was tiny.
Over what could this king really rule?
target: يا ترى الملك كان بيحكم مين؟

source: Sire, he said to him, I beg that you will excuse my asking you a question
I order you to ask me a question, the king hastened to assure him.
target: فرد الملك بسرعة: أنا بأمرك تسألني .

source: Sire, over what do you rule?
Over everything, said the king, with magnificent simplicity.
target: فرد الملك ببساطة: باحكم كل حاجة.

source: Over everything? The king made a gesture, which took in his planet, the other planets, and all the stars.
target: كل حاجة؟ بحركة من إيده، شـاور الملك على الكوكب بتاعه، وعلى الكواكب التانية، وعلى النجوم .

source: Over all that? asked the little prince.
Over all that, the king answered.
For his rule was not only absolute: it was also universal.
target: عشـان سـلطانه ماکانش بس سلطان مطلق ده كان سلطان على الكون كمان.

source: And the stars obey you?
Certainly they do, the king said. They obey instantly.
I do not permit insubordination.
Such power was a thing for the little prince to marvel at.
target: الأمير الصغير اندهش من القدرة دي.

source: If he had been master of such complete authority, he would have been able to watch the sunset, not forty-four times in one day, but seventy-two, or even a hundred, or even two hundred times, with out ever having to move his chair.
target: لو كانت عنده هو كان ممكن يتفرج، مش بس على أربعة وأربعين، لا على اثنين وسبعين، أو حق مية، أو ممكن متين غروب، من غير ما يحتاج إنه ينـد الكرسي بتاعه أبدا!

source: And because he felt a bit sad as he remembered his little planet, which he had forsaken, he plucked up his courage to ask the king a favour:
target: وزي ما يكون حس بشوية حزن بسبب ذكريات الكوكب بناعه إللي سابه، واتشجع وطلب منحة من الملك

source: I should like to see a sunset.
Do me that kindness.
Order the sun to set.

If I ordered a general to fly from one flower to another like a butterfly, or to write a tragic drama, or to change himself into a sea bird, and if the general did not carry out the order that he had received, which one of us would be in the wrong? the king demanded. The general, or myself?
target: لو طلبت من قائد إنه يطير من وردة للتانية زي الفراشة، أو إنه يكتب قصة تراجيدية، أو إنه يتحول لطائر النورس، والقائد مانفذش الأمر إللي أخده، مين فينا، أنا والا هو، إللي هيكون غلطان؟

source: You, said the little prince firmly.
target: رد الأمير الصغير بقوة: هتكون حضرتك الغلطان.

source: Exactly. One much require from each one the duty which each one can perform, the king went on.
target: بالظبط. لازم أطلب من كل واحد، إللي كل واحد يقدر عليه في الأصل.

source: Accepted authority rests first of all on reason.
If you ordered your people to go and throw themselves into the sea, they would rise up in revolution.
target: ولو أمرت شعبك إنهم يرمو نفسهم في البحر، هيعملو ثورة .

source: I have the right to require obedience because my orders are reasonable.
target: لكن أنا من حقي أفرض الـطـاعـة عشان أنا أوامري حكيمة.

source: Then my sunset? the little prince reminded him: for he never forgot a question once he had asked it.
target: الأمير الصغير إللي لما بيسأل سؤال عمره ما بينساه أبدا ولا حتى مرة واحدة في حياته، فكره:

source: You shall have your sunset.
I shall command it.
target: الغروب بتاعك، هتشوفه، أنا هأمر بيه.

source: But, according to my science of government, I shall wait until conditions are favourable.
target: لكن حسب علمي بأمور الحكم، أنا هاستنى شوية عشان الظروف تكون مناسبة.

source: When will that be? inquired the little prince.
target: الأمير الصغير سأله: إمتى هتكون مناسبة ؟

source: Hum! Hum! replied the king; and before saying anything else he consulted a bulky almanac.
target: رد عليه الملك بعد ما دور في نتيجة كبيرة.

source: Hum! Hum! That will be about, that will be this evening about twenty minutes to eight.
target: إحم! إحم! هيكون، حوالي هيكون الليلة دي حوالي الساعة ثمانية إلا تلت!

source: And you will see how well I am obeyed.
target: وهاتشوف ساعتها قد إيه أنا مطاع.

source: The little prince yawned.
He was regretting his lost sunset. And then, too, he was already beginning to be a little bored.
target: كان زعلان على الغروب بتاعه إللي راح عليه وكان زهق بالفعل شوية.

source: I have nothing more to do here, he said to the king. So I shall set out on my way again.
target: فقال للملك: مافيش حاجة أعملها هنا، أنا هامشي!

source: Do not go, said the king, who was very proud of having a subject.
target: رد الملك إللي كان فخور أوي إنه لقى واحد من الرعية:

source: Do not go. I will make you a Minister!
Minister of what?
Minster of Justice!
But there is nobody here to judge!
We do not know that, the king said to him.
I have not yet made a complete tour of my kingdom.
I am very old. And it tires me to walk.
There is no room here for a carriage.
Oh, but I have looked already! said the little prince, turning around to give one more glance to the other side of the planet.
target: الأمير الصغير قال بعد ما مال عشان يبص على الناحية الثانية من الكوكب: ياه! أنا بصيت خلاص، مافيش أي حد هناك كمان.

source: Then you shall judge yourself, the king answered, that is the most difficult thing of all.
target: يبقى هتحاكم نفسك. دي أصـعب حاجة.

source: It is much more difficult to j udge oneself than to j udge others.
target: أصعب كتير إن الواحد يحاكم نفسه من إنه يحاكم غيره.

source: If you succeed in judging yourself rightly, then you are indeed a man of true wisdom.
target: لو نجحت إنك تحكم نفسك كويس، يبقى أنت حكيم بجد.

source: Yes, said the little prince, but I can judge myself anywhere.
target: الأمير الصغير قال: أنا ممكن أحاكم نفسي في أي حتة

source: I do not need to live on this planet.
Hum! Hum! said the king. I have good reason to believe that somewhere on my planet there is an old rat.
target: إحم! إحم! أنا بيتهيألي إن فيه فار عجوز موجود في مكان على الكوكب.

source: I hear him at night.
You can judge this old rat.
From time to time you will condemn him to death.
target: وممكن تحكم عليه بالإعدام من وقت لتاني.

source: But you will pardon him on each occasion; for he must be treated thriftily.
target: بس هنعفو عنه في كل مرة، عـشان تحافظ عليه.

source: He is the only one we have.
I, replied the little prince, do not like to condemn anyone to death.
target: رد الأمير الصغير: أنا ماحبش أحكم على حد بالإعدام.

source: And now I think I will go on my way.
No, said the king.
But the little prince, having now completed his preparations for departure, had no wish to grieve the old monarch.
target: لكن بعد ما خلص الأمير الصغيرإستعداداته، مارضيش ينكد ع السلطان العجوز

source: If Your Majesty wishes to be promptly obeyed, he said, he should be able to give me a reasonable order.
target: لو جلالتك تحب إني أسمع كلامك على طول، لازم تديني أمر حكيم.

source: He should be able, for example, to order me to be gone by the end of one minute.
target: ممكن جلالتك تؤمرني مثلا، إني أمشي قبل ما تفوت دقيقة.

source: It seems to me that conditions are favourable.
target: أنا شايف إن الظروف هتكون مناسبة ...

source: As the king made no answer, the little prince hesitated a moment. Then, with a sigh, he took his leave.
target: لما الملك ماردش، إتردد الأمير الصغير في الأول، وبعدها، كمل سفره وهو بيتنهد.

source: I made you my Ambassador, the king called out, hastily.
target: فالملك قاله بسرعة وبصوت عالي: أنا عينتك السفير بتاعي.

source: He had a magnificent air of authority.
The grown-ups are very strange, the little prince said to himself, as he continued on his journey.
target: والأمير الصغير قال في نفسه، وهو مكمل رحلته: الكبار دول ناس غريبة فعلا

source: The second planet was inhabited by a conceited man.
target: الكوكب التاني كان ساكن عليه واحد مغرور

source: Ah! Ah! I am about to receive a visit from an admirer! he exclaimed from afar, when he first saw the little prince coming.
target: صرخ أول ما لمح الأمير الصغير وقال: أهو! أهو! واحد معجب جاي يزورني.

source: For, to conceited men, all other men are admirers.
target: عشان المغرورين بيعتبرو الناس الباقيين كلهم معجبين.

source: Good morning, said the little prince.
That is a queer hat you are wearing.
It is a hat for salutes, the conceited man replied.
target: رد عليه المغرور: دي عشان أحي بها.

source: It is to raise in salute when people acclaim me.
Unfortunately, nobody at all ever passes this way.
target: لكن للأسف ما حدش بيعدي من هنا أبدا.

source: Yes? said the little prince, who did not understand what the conceited man was talking about.
target: رد عليه الأمير الصغير وهو مش فاهم: ياه، فعلا؟

source: Clap your hands, one against the other, the conceited man now directed him.
target: المغرور قاله وهو بيفهمه يعمل إيه: إخبط بإيدك على التانية.

source: The little prince clapped his hands. The conceited man raised his hat in a modest salute.
target: فالأمير الصغير صقف بإيده على التانية، فرفع الراجل المغرور البرنيطة بتاعته وحياه بتواضع.

source: This is more entertaining than the visit to the king, the little prince said to himself.
target: الأمير الصغير قال لنفسه الحكاية هنا مسلية أكثر من زيارة الملك.

source: And he began again to clap his hands, one against the other.
The conceited man against raised his hat in salute.
target: فرفع الراجل المغرور البرنيطة بتاعته وحياه تاني.

source: After five minutes of this exercise the little prince grew tired of the game’s monotony.
target: وبعد خمس دقايق من التكرار، الأمير الصغير زهق من اللعبة وحس إنها مملة، فسأل:

source: And what should one do to make the hat come down? he asked.
target: طيب، لازم نعمل إيه ،عشان نخلي البرنيطة تقع ؟

source: But the conceited man did not hear him.
Conceited people never hear anything but praise.
target: الناس المغرورين ما بيسمعوش غير المدح.

source: Do you really admire me very much? he demanded of the little prince.
target: فالراجل المغرور سأله: إنت حقيقي معجب بيا أوي؟

source: What does that mean, ‘admire’?
To admire means that you regard me as the handsomest, the best-dressed, the richest, and the most intelligent man on this planet.
target: تكون معجب يعني تكون عارف إن أنا أجم، وأشيك، وأغنى، وأذكى واحد على الكوكب.

source: But you are the only man on your planet!
target: بس مافيش غيرك على الكوكب بتاعك

source: Admire me just the same.
I admire you, said the little prince, shrugging his shoulders slightly, but what is there in that to interest you so much?
target: فالأمير الصغير هز كتافه وهو بيقوله: أنا معجب بيك، لكن ده ممكن يهمك في إيه ؟

source: And the little prince went away.
The grown-ups are certainly very odd, he said to himself, as he continued on his journey.
target: وقال في نفسه ببساطة وهو بيكمل رحلته: الكبار فعلا ناس عجيبة جدا.

source: The next planet was inhabited by a tippler.
target: الكوكب إللي بعده كان ساكن فيه واحد سكران

source: This was a very short visit, but it plunged the little prince into deep dejection.
target: الزيارة دي كانت قصيرة أوي، لكن خلت الأمير الصغير يغوص في حزن عميق.

source: What are you doing there? he said to the tippler, whom he found settled down in silence before a collection of empty bottles and also a collection of full bottles.
target: الراجل السكران كان قاعد وسط مجموعة أزايز فاضية ومجموعة أزايز مليانة، فالأمير الصغير قاله: إنت بتعمل إيه هنا ؟

source: I am drinking, replied the tippler, with a lugubrious air.
Why are you drinking? demanded the little prince.
So that I may forget, replied the tippler.
Forget what? inquired the little prince, who already was sorry for him.
target: حاول الأمير الصغير يستفسر منه أكثر وهو صعبان عليه. عشان تنسى ايه ؟

source: Forget that I am ashamed, the tippler confessed, hanging his head.
target: فالسكران وطى راسه ورد كإنه بيعترف له: عشان أنسى عاري.

source: Ashamed of what? insisted the little prince, who wanted to help him.
target: فسأله الأمير الصغير وهو بيتمنى ينقذه: عارك إيه؟

source: Ashamed of drinking!
The tippler brought his speech to an end, and shut himself up in an impregnable silence.
target: خلص كلامه وسكت زي ما يكون سجن نفسه.

source: And the little prince went away, puzzled.
The grown-ups are certainly very, very odd, he said to himself, as he continued on his journey.
target: وقال في نفسه وهو بيكمل رحلته: الكبار فعلا ناس عجيبة جدا جدا.

source: The fourth planet belonged to a businessman.
This man was so much occupied that he did not even raise his head at the little prince’s arrival.
target: وده كان راجل مشغول لدرجة إنه ما رفعش راسه لما الأمير الصغير وصل

source: Good morning, the little prince said to him.
Your cigarette has gone out.
Three and two make five.
Five and seven make twelve.
Twelve and three make fifteen.
Fifteen and seven make twenty-two.
Twenty-two and six make twenty-eight.
I haven’t time to light it again.
Twenty-six and five make thirty-one.
Phew!
Then that makes five-hundredand-one-million, six-hundred-twenty-two-thousand, seven-hundred-thirty-one.
target: يبقى المجموع يعمل خمسمية وواحد مليون ستمية إتنين وعشرين ألف وسيعمية واحد وثلاثين.

source: Five hundred million what? asked the little prince.
Eh? Are you still there?
Five-hundred-andone million, I can’t stop.
target: خمسميت مليون، أنا ما بقتش عارف أقف.

source: I have so much to do!
I am concerned with matters of consequence.
I don’t amuse myself with balderdash.
target: أنا مش باشغل نفسي بالحاجات التافهة!

source: Two and five make seven.
Five-hundred-and-one million what? repeated the little prince, who never in his life had let go of a question once he had asked it.
target: الأمير الصغير إللى لما بيسأل سؤال عمره ما بيتنازل عنه أ أبدا ولا حتى مرة واحدة في حياته، كرر سؤاله: خمسمية وواحد مليون إيه؟

source: The businessman raised his head.
During the fifty-four years that I have inhabited this planet, I have been disturbed only three times.
target: أنا ساكن على الكوكب ده من أربعة وخمسين سنة، ماحدش أزعجني غير تلت مرات.

source: The first time was twenty-two years ago, when some giddy goose fell from goodness knows where.
target: أول مرة كانت من إثنين وعشرين سنة، لما خنفسة وقعت عليا ما عرفش منين.

source: He made the most frightful noise that resounded all over the place, and I made four mistakes in my addition.
target: وعملت دوشة رهيبة، لدرجة إلي عملت أربع غلطات في حسبة.

source: The second time, eleven years ago, I was disturbed by an attack of rheumatism.
target: والمرة التانية كانت من حداشر سنة، لما جاتني أزمة الروماتيزم من نقص التمارين.

source: I don’t get enough exercise.
I have no time for loafing.
The third time, well, this is it!
I was saying, then, five -hundred-and-one millions Millions of what?
target: كنت باقول بقى خمسمية وواحد مليون... مليون إيه ؟

source: The businessman suddenly realised that there was no hope of being left in peace until he answered this question.
target: البزنسمان فهم إن ما فيش نقطة أمل إن الأمير الصغير يسيبه في حاله لو ماردش على السؤال:

source: Millions of those little objects, he said, which one sometimes sees in the sky.
target: مليون بتاعة من الصغيرين دول إللي بنشوفهم ساعات في السماء

source: Flies? Oh, no.
Little glittering objects.
Bees? Oh, no.
Little golden objects that set lazy men to idle dreaming.
target: لأ, البتوع الدهبي إللي بيخلو الناس الكسلانين يحلمو وهما صاحيين.

source: As for me, I am concerned with matters of consequence.
There is no time for idle dreaming in my life.
target: أنا ماعنديش وقت أحلم وأنا صاحي.

source: Ah! You mean the stars?
Yes, that’s it.
The stars.
And what do you do with five-hundred millions of stars?
target: وانت بتعمل إيه بخمسميت مليون نجمة؟

source: Five-hundred-and-one million, six-hundred-twenty-two thousand, seven-hundred-thirty-one.
target: خمسمية وواحد مليون مستمية إتنين وعشرين ألف وسبعمية واحد وثلاثين.

source: I am concerned with matters of consequence.
I am accurate.
And what do you do with these stars?
What do I do with them?
Yes.
Nothing.
I own them.
But I have already seen a king who.
Kings do not own, they reign over.
It is a very different matter.
And what good does it do you to own the stars?
target: وإنت بتستفيد إيه لما تمتلك النجوم ؟

source: It does me the good of making me rich.
And what good does it do you to be rich?
It makes it possible for me to buy more stars, if any are ever discovered.
target: إني أقدر أشتري نجوم تانية لو حد لقاها.

source: This man, the little prince said to himself, reasons a little like my poor tippler.
target: الأمير الصغير قال لنفسه: الراجل ده بيفكر تقريبا بنفس طريقة الراجل السكران

source: Nevertheless, he still had some more questions.
How is it possible for one to own the stars?
To whom do they belong? the businessman retorted, peevishly.
target: رد البزنسمان بنرفزة: هي بتاعت مين؟

source: I don’t know.
To nobody.
Then they belong to me, because I was the first person to think of it.
target: تبقى بتاعتي عشان أنا أول واحد فكر الفكرة دي.

source: Is that all that is necessary?
Certainly.
When you find a diamond that belongs to nobody, it is yours.
target: إنت لو لقيت الماظة مش بتاعت حد، تبقى بتاعتك.

source: When you discover an island that belongs to nobody, it is yours.
target: لو لاقيت جزيرة مش بتاعت حد، تبقى بتاعتك.

source: When you get an idea before any one else, you take out a patent on it: it is yours.
target: لو جتلك فكرة ما جتش لحد قبلك، وسجلتها تبقى بتاعتك.

source: So with me: I own the stars, because nobody else before me ever thought of owning them.
target: وأنا بامتلك النجوم، بما إن ماحدش فكر أبدا يمتلكها قبلي.

source: Yes, that is true, said the little prince.
And what do you do with them?
I administer them, replied the businessman.
I count them and recount them.
target: أنا باعدها مرة وإتنين وبارجع أعدها كمان وكمان.

source: It is difficult.
But I am a man who is naturally interested in matters of consequence.
The little prince was still not satisfied.
If I owned a silk scarf, he said, I could put it around my neck and take it away with me.
target: أنا، لو بامتلك كوفية، هالبسها وها حطها حوالين رقبتي

source: If I owned a flower, I could pluck that flower and take it away with me.
target: أنا، عندي وردة، أقدر أقطفها وأخدها معايا في كل حتة.

source: But you cannot pluck the stars from heaven.
target: لكن إنت ما تقدرش تقطف النجوم.

source: No. But I can put them in the bank.
target: لأ، لكن ممكن أحطها في البنك.

source: Whatever does that mean?
That means that I write the number of my stars on a little paper. And then I put this paper in a drawer and lock it with a key.
target: يعني أكتب عدد النجوم بتاعتي على ورقة صغيرة وأحط الورقة دي في درج وأقفل عليها بالمفتاح.

source: And that is all?
That is enough, said the businessman.
It is entertaining, thought the little prince.
It is rather poetic.
But it is of no great consequence.
On matters of consequence, the little prince had ideas, which were very different from those of the grown-ups.
target: فكرة الأمير الصغير عن الحاجات المهمة كانت مختلفة خالص عن فكرة الكبار.

source: I myself own a flower, he continued his conversation with the businessman, which I water every day.
target: كان بيقول: أنا، عندي وردة باسقيها كل يوم.

source: I own three volcanoes, which I clean out every week (for I also clean out the one that is extinct; one never knows).
target: عندي تلت براكين بنضفهم كل إسبوع. عشان بانضف كمان البركان إللي مش شغال. عشان ماحدش عارف.

source: It is of some use to my volcanoes, and it is of some use to my flower, that I own them.
target: أنا مفيد للبراكين بتاعتي، ومفيد للوردة بتاعتي، إمتلاكي لهم بيفدهم.

source: But you are of no use to the stars.
The businessman opened his mouth, but he found nothing to say in answer.
target: البزنسمان فتح بقه عشان يرد لكن مالقاش كلام يقوله

source: The grown-ups are certainly altogether extraordinary, he said simply, talking to himself as he continued on his journey.
target: وقال في نفسه ببساطة وهو بيكمل رحلته: الكبار فعلا ناس مذهلين جدا.

source: The fifth planet was very strange.
It was the smallest of all.
There was just enough room on it for a street lamp and a lamplighter.
target: و ما كانش فيه غير يادوب مكان لعامود نور وواحد راجل شغلته إنه ينور عامود النور.

source: The little prince was not able to reach any explanation of the use of a street lamp and a lamplighter, somewhere in the heavens, on a planet, which had no people, and not one house.
target: الأمير الصغير ماقدرش يوصل لفايدة عامود نور وراجل شغلته إنه ينوره، على كوكب من غير بيوت، ولا سكان في حتة كده في السما،.

source: But he said to himself, nevertheless: It may well be that this man is absurd.
target: لكن قال لنفسه: ممكن فعلا يكون الراجل ده عبثي.

source: But he is not so absurd as the king, the conceited man, the businessman, and the tippler.
target: لكن عبثيته أقل من عبثية الملك، والراجل المغرور والبزنسمان، والراجل السكران.

source: For at least his work has some meaning.
When he lights his street lamp, it is as if he brought one more star to life, or one flower.
target: لما بينور العامود بتاعه بيبقى كانه خلق نجمة زيادة، أو وردة.

source: When he puts out his lamp, he sends the flower, or the star, to sleep.
target: ولما بيطفي العامود بتاعه بيبقى زي ما يكون نيم الوردة أو النجمة .

source: That is a beautiful occupation.
And since it is beautiful, it is truly useful.
target: الحاجات بتبقى فعلا مفيدة لو هي جميلة

source: When he arrived on the planet he respectfully saluted the lamplighter.
target: ولما قرب من الكوكب سلم على الراجل اللي بينور العامود باحترام:

source: Good morning.
Why have you just put out your lamp? Those are the orders, replied the lamplighter.
target: إنت ليه طفيت العامود بتاعك دلوقتي؟

source: What are the orders?
The orders are that I put out my lamp.
Good evening.
And he lighted his lamp again.
But why have you just lighted it again?
Those are the orders, replied the lamplighter.
I do not understand, said the little prince.
target: الأمير الصغير قال: أنا مش فاهم.

source: There is nothing to understand, said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل إللي بينور العامود قال: مافيش حاجة تتفهم

source: Orders are orders.
And he put out his lamp.
Then he mopped his forehead with a handkerchief decorated with red squares.
target: ومسح بعدها وشه بمنديل أحمر كاروهات.

source: I follow a terrible profession.
In the old days it was reasonable.
I put the lamp out in the morning, and in the evening I lighted it again.
I had the rest of the day for relaxation and the rest of the night for sleep.
target: وكان عندي بقية النهار عشان أرتاح، وبقية الليل عشان أنام

source: And the orders have been changed since that time?
target: وبعدين ؟ إيه إللي حصل بعد كده، الأوامر إتغيرت؟

source: The orders have not been changed, said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل اللي بينور العامود قال: الأوامر ماتغيرتش.

source: That is the tragedy!
From year to year the planet has turned more rapidly and the orders have not been changed!
target: الكوكب إبتدى يلف أسرع سنة بعد سنة، والأوامر ماتغيرتش!

source: Then what? asked the little prince.
Then the planet now makes a complete turn every minute, and I no longer have a single second for repose.
target: وبعدين الكوكب دلوقتي بيلف لفة كل دقيقة، ومابقاش عندي ولا ثانية أرتاح.

source: Once every minute I have to light my lamp and put it out!
That is very funny!
A day lasts only one minute, here where you live!
It is not funny at all! said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل اللي بينور العامود قال: دي مش حاجة تضحك أبدا.

source: While we have been talking together a month has gone by.
target: إحنا بقالنا شهر بنتكلم مع بعض

source: A month?
Yes, thirty minutes.
Thirty days.
And he lighted his lamp again.
As the little prince watched him, he felt that he loved this lamplighter who was so faithful to his orders.
target: الأمير الصغير بص للراجل اللي بينور العامود وحبه عشان إخلاصه الكبير للأوامر.

source: He remembered the sunsets, which he himself had gone to seek, in other days, merely by pulling up his chair; and he wanted to help his friend.
target: وإفتكر لما كان هو نفسه بيمشي ورا الغروب وهو بيشد الكرسي بتاعه. وكان عايز يساعد صاحبه:

source: You know, he said, I can tell you a way you can rest whenever you want to.
target: إنت عارف، أنا عندي طريقة تخليك تستريح وقت ما تحب

source: I always want to rest, said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل قال: أنا أحب أستريح على طول.

source: For it is possible for a man to be faithful and lazy at the same time.
target: عشان الواحد ممكن يبقى مخلص وكسول، في نفس الوقت.

source: The little prince went on with his explanation: Your planet is so small that three strides will take you all the way around it.
target: الأمير الصغير كمل: الكوكب بتاعك صغير لدرجة إنك ممكن تلفه في تلت خطوات.

source: To be always in the sunshine, you need only walk along rather slowly.
target: كل إللي عليك تعمله هو إنك تمشي بشويش كفاية عشان تفضل دايما في االشمس.

source: When you want to rest, you will walk and the day will last as long as you like.
target: فلما تحب تستريح، تتمشى واليوم هيطول زي ما إنت عايز.

source: That doesn’t do me much good, said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل اللي بينور قال: ده مش هيفدني في حاجة

source: The one thing I love in life is to sleep.
target: أكتر حاجة أنا باحبها في الدنيا هي النوم.

source: Then you’re unlucky, said the little prince.
I am unlucky, said the lamplighter.
target: الراجل إللي بينور العامود قال: يا خسارة.

source: That man, said the little prince to himself, as he continued farther on his journey, that man would be scorned by all the others: by the king, by the conceited man, by the tippler, by the businessman. Nevertheless he is the only one of them all who does not seem to me ridiculous. Perhaps that is because he is thinking of something else besides himself.
target: الأمير الصغير قال لنفسه وهو بيكمل رحلته لحتة أبعد: كل الباقيين هيحتقرو الراجل ده الملك هيحتقره، والراجل المغرور، والسكران، والبزنسمان مع إنه الوحيد إللي شكله مش عبيط ده ممكن يكون بسبب إنه مشغول بحاجة تانية غير نفسه.

source: He breathed a sigh of regret, and said to himself, again: That man is the only one of them all whom I could have made my friend.
target: إتنهد تنهيدة ندم وقال لنفسه كمان: الراجل ده هو الوحيد اللي كان يقدر يبقى صاحبي.

source: But his planet is indeed too small.
target: بس الكوكب بتاعه فعلا صغير جدا.

source: There is no room on it for two people.
What the little prince did not dare confess was that he was sorry most of all to leave this planet, because it was blest every day with 1440 sunsets!
target: الحاجة إللي الأمير الصغير ماقدرش يعترف بها هي إنه ندمان على الكوكب المحظوظ ده خصوصا عشان الألف وربعمية وأربعين غروب كل أربعة وعشرين ساعة!

source: The sixth planet was ten times larger than the last one.
target: الكوكب السادس كان أوسع عشر مرات

source: It was inhabited by an old gentleman who wrote voluminous books.
target: كان ساكن عليه أستاذ عجوز بيكتب كتب ضخمة.

source: Oh, look! Here is an explorer! he exclaimed to himself when he saw the little prince coming.
target: أول ما لمح الأمير الصغير قال بصوت عالي: الحق! أخير مستكشف!

source: The little prince sat down on the table and panted a little.
target: الأمير الصغير قعد على الترابيزة عشان ياخد نفسُه شوية.

source: He had already travelled so much and so far!
target: الرحلة إللي عملها كانت طويلة فعلا!

source: Where do you come from? the old gentleman said to him.
target: الأستاذ العجوز قال له: إنت جاي منين؟

source: What is that big book? said the little prince.
target: الأمير الصغير قال: إيه الكتاب التخين ده؟

source: What are you doing?
I am a geographer, the old gentleman said to him.
What is a geographer? asked the little prince.
A geographer is a scholar who knows the location of all the seas, rivers, towns, mountains, and deserts.
target: ده العالم إللي بيعرف مكان البحور، والأنهار، والمدن، والجبال والصحاري.

source: That is very interesting, said the little prince.
target: الأمير الصغير قال: دي حاجة ممتعة

source: Here at last is a man who has a real profession!
And he cast a look around him at the planet of the geographer.
target: ورمى بصة حواليه على الكوكب بتاع الجغرافي.

source: It was the most magnificent and stately planet that he had ever seen.
target: ما هو ماكانش شاف قبل كده كوكب بالعظمة دي.

source: Your planet is very beautiful, he said.
Has it any oceans?
I couldn’t tell you, said the geographer.
Ah! The little prince was disappointed.
Has it any mountains?
I couldn’t tell you, said the geographer.
And towns, and rivers, and deserts?
I couldn’t tell you that, either.
But you are a geographer! Exactly, the geographer said.
But I am not an explorer.
target: االجغرافي قال: بالظبط، لكن أنا مش مستكشف.

source: I haven’t a single explorer on my planet.
It is not the geographer who goes out to count the towns, the rivers, the mountains, the seas, the oceans, and the deserts.
target: مش الجغرافي هو اللي هيروح يعد المدن والأنهار والجبال والبحار والمحيطات، والصحاري.

source: The geographer is much too important to go loafing about.
target: الجغرافي أهم بكثير من إنه يتفسح.

source: He does not leave his desk.
But he receives the explorers in his study.
He asks them questions, and he notes down what they recall of their travels.
target: وبيسألهم ييكتب كل إللي هما فاكرينه.

source: And if the recollections of any one among them seem interesting to him, the geographer orders an inquiry into that explorer’s moral character.
target: ولو واحد فيهم كانت الحاجات إللي فاكرها باين عليها مهمة في الحالة دي الجغرافي بيطلب تحقيق عن خلاق المستكشف ده.

source: Why is that?
Because an explorer who told lies would bring disaster on the books of the geographer. So would an explorer who drank too much.
target: عشان لو المستكشف كان بيكدب هيدخل كوارث في كتب الجغرافيا وخصوصا لو كان المستكشف بيسكر كتير.

source: Why is that? asked the little prince.
Because intoxicated men see double.
target: عشان السكرانين بيشوفو كل حاجة إتنين.

source: Then the geographer would note down two mountains in a place where there was only one.
target: وبالطريقة دي الجغرافي هيسجل جبلين في المكان اللي فيه جبل واحد.

source: I know some one, said the little prince, who would make a bad explorer.
target: الأمير الصغير قال: أنا أعرف واحد، ممكن يبقى مستكشف وحش أوي.

source: That is possible.
Then, when the moral character of the explorer is shown to be good, an inquiry is ordered into his discovery.
target: ولما بيظهر إن أخلاق المستكشف كويسة، بنعمل تحقيق عن الإكتشاف بتاعه.

source: One goes to see it?
No.
That would be too complicated.
But one requires the explorer to furnish proofs.
target: بس إحنا بنطلب من المستكشف يجيبلنا إثباتات.

source: For example, if the discovery in question is that of a large mountain, one requires that large stones be brought back from it.
target: مثلا، لو بنتكلم عن جبل كبير بنطلب منه يجيبلنا طوب كبير.

source: The geographer was suddenly stirred to excitement.
But you come from far away!
target: بس إنت! إنت جاي من حتة بعيدة!

source: You are an explorer!
You shall describe your planet to me!
And, having opened his big register, the geographer sharpened his pencil.
target: وفتح الجغرافي الدفتر بتاعه وهو بيبري قلمه الرصاص.
